title: Voices of Care: Actor-Centric Analysis of Alzheimer’s and Dementia Discourse on Reddit
authors: Umme Kulsum Tumpa, Nazifa Tasnim Hia , Md Shahrar Fatemi, Md. Mahbubul Alam Joarder, Shebuti Rayana
publishedIn: Accepted to IEEE Workshop on Big Data & ML in Healthcare: Emerging Challenges (BDML 2025)
description: Our study explores how caregivers, patients and community members discuss Alzheimer’s and dementia on Reddit. By analyzing these real-life conversations, we aimed to understand the emotional and practical challenges that caregivers face and why online spaces have become sources of shared learning, empathy, and support. We also examined some patient-related demographics through the caregivers’ narratives to learn how patients’ symptoms differ across these demographics.

title: Exploring Cross-Lingual Knowledge Transfer via Transliteration-Based MLM Fine-Tuning for Critically Low-resource Chakma Language
authors: Adity Khisa, Nusrat Jahan Lia, Tasnim Mahfuz Nafis, Zarif Masud, Tanzir Pial, Shebuti Rayana, Ahmedul Kabir
description: As an Indo-Aryan language with limited available data, Chakma remains largely underrepresented in language models. In this work, we introduce a novel corpus of contextually coherent Bangla-transliterated Chakma, curated from Chakma literature, and validated by native speakers. Using this dataset, we fine-tune six encoder-based multilingual and regional transformer models (mBERT, XLM-RoBERTa, DistilBERT, DeBERTaV3, BanglaBERT, and IndicBERT) on masked language modeling (MLM) tasks. Our experiments show that fine-tuned multilingual models outperform their pre-trained counterparts when adapted to Bangla-transliterated Chakma, achieving up to 73.54% token accuracy and a perplexity as low as 2.90.

title: Temporal Analysis of the Gap Between Media Narratives and Public Sentiment During Bangladesh's July Revolution
authors: Abhijit Paul, Tanvir Hasan Abir, Siam Rahman, Dr. Shebuti Rayana, Dr. Ahmedul Kabir, Zarif Masud
description: Examines the temporal divergence between media narratives and public sentiment during Bangladesh’s July Revolution by analyzing over 10,000 Reddit posts and news articles from five mainstream Bangladeshi newspapers, utilizing computational sentiment analysis to identify discrepancies in focus and tone.

title: State-of-the-Art Translation of Text-to-Gloss using mBART : A case study of Bangla
authors: Sharif Md. Abdullah, Abhijit Paul, Dr. Shebuti Rayana, Dr. Ahmedul Kabir, Zarif Masud
description: Proposes a state-of-the-art methodology for text-to-gloss translation, a critical component of the text-to-sign translation pipeline, leveraging mBART to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of translating Bangla text into gloss for sign language applications.
